name: Bronze Featherback
description: Featherbacks earned their Czech name from their distinctive laterally flattened body shape. Young bronze featherbacks have a bronze coloration with dark stripes, while older fish are a uniform light brown to silvery hue.
spread_note: Southern and Southeast Asia, from southern India to Vietnam, Sumatra, and Java
food_note: Insects, crustaceans, small fish, young roots of aquatic plants
proportions: Length up to 60 cm, though usually smaller in captivity
reproduction: Females likely guard the spawning site and briefly the hatched fry.
attractions: The bronze featherback is a relatively slow fish, preferring calm waters. During the rainy season, it migrates to flooded forests to spawn. It can survive briefly in brackish water. Active at night, it seeks daytime shelter among submerged vegetation or under logs. A sought-after game fish, itâ€™s also popular with aquarists, though juveniles are sensitive to water quality. It behaves territorially toward other featherbacks but coexists well with different fish species.
